direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods involve checking the presence of an option by its name.
Both methods process the input string to find matching options, though getMatchingOptions returns a list of matching options.
Both methods check for the presence of an option, specifically focusing on long options.
Both methods check for the presence of an option, specifically focusing on short options.
Both methods access and retrieve information related to options, though getOptionGroup retrieves the group an option belongs to.

enhanced_by.reason: Adding an option is necessary to have options available for retrieval by getOption.
Adding option groups can influence the options available, affecting getOption.
Checking if an option exists before retrieving it can be part of the test setup.
Retrieving the option group can be used to verify the context in which the option was retrieved.
Verifying the presence of an option after retrieval can be part of the assertions.
